intro: Rhipidoglossum eggelingii, commonly known as the Cape sugarbush, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, oval leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in coastal fynbos vegetation, thriving in well-drained, sandy soils. It produces small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its ecological significance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens.
